alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued November 13 at 2:49PM AKST until November 13 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. North winds gusting 35 to 50 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Falling and blowing snow will produce white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds are shifting from easterly to northerly and will rapidly strengthen, leading to development of blizzard conditions. Even though snow is tapering off, continued gusty winds will lead to a ground blizzard and cause drifting snow to persist through the evening hours.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
